title: docs(http): note about timing out administrator
feat(http,validate)!: validate attachment filenames
body:
Ensure attachment filenames are composed of ASCII alphanumeric characters, dots, dashes, or underscores.

Closes #1465.

title: refactor(http,validate)!: move audit reason validation
body:
Removes `AuditLogReasonError` and its `Type`. Move audit reason's validation to the `validate` crate, and update all implementations.

Closes #1476.

title: feat(model): bring `MessageFlags` up to date
body:
Updates the `MessageFlags` bitflags to the current state of the Discord docs, and document each flag.

Closes #1496.

title: feat(http,model): scheduled event cover images
body:
Adds `GuildScheduledEvent::image`. Adds methods to `CreateGuildScheduledEvent`'s derivatives and `UpdateGuildScheduledEvent` to add and update the image.

Closes #1502.

title: feat(model): add `type` and `target_id` fields to `CommandData`
body:
Resolves #1515

To get around the issue of `target_id` being an ID to either a user or a message, this PR represents it with a generic ID.
It would be possible to make it more strongly typed, e.g. something like:

```rust
enum CommandPayload {
    ChatInput(Vec<CommandDataOption>),
    User(Id<User>),
    Message(Id<Message>),
}
```

That might be overcomplicating things though, and/or diverging too far from the actual API.

title: refactor(gateway,model)!: rename `GUILD_EMOJIS` intent and make corresponding changes
ci: add build label to labeler
build(cache/inmemory,lavalink,standby): Update dashmap to 5.1

labels.name: t-build
labels.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies

body:
The 5.0 release was yanked from crates.io due to critical issues (see e.g. #1434), and a fixed 5.1 release has been drafted by the owner.

This bumps the dependency on `dashmap` to 5.1 and behaves just like 5.0 did - with the exception of the `send_guard` feature now being disabled in 5.1 due to default features being disabled. This prevents unintended behaviour on user side and happens to not be required with how twilight currently uses `dashmap`.

title: docs(http,model): fix broken associated builder links
body: it'd be nice if it linked to api.twilight.rs if the link is clicked there, but i don't think that's doable easily.. also is there any other broken links in the docs?

title: refactor(http,model)!: `InteractionResponse` changes
body:
This PR contains two changes.

First, move `InteractionResponse` (and `Attachment`) from `http` to a new `model` module, `model::http`. This is a first step in separating models that we send and that we receive from Discord over HTTP.  Eventually, all models in `model::http` will exclusively be used when sending data to Discord.

Second, `InteractionResponse` itself is no longer a complicated enum, and now simply serializes and deserializes just as Discord expects. This saves developer effort in writing and testing custom serde code, which allows for adding more fields much faster. Users will either need to manually create an `InteractionResponseData` themselves, or use the renamed `InteractionResponseDataBuilder` (formerly `CallbackDataBuilder`).

title: refactor(cache, model)!: make channel a struct

milestone.title: Model Rework
milestone.description: Rework the model crate from the ground up by: preventing breaking changes through new fields; optimizing fields where possible, such as parsing datetime strings; and documenting fields.

body:
Convert the `twilight_model::channel::Channel` type from an enum with many sub-types to one single concise struct.

As it currently stands, our `Channel` type is an enum with three variants: `Group`, `PrivateChannel`, and `GuildChannel`. The former two are self-descriptive and structs of only data that should be available in those cases. `GuildChannel` is another enum with *seven* variants, three of which are thread types.

One issue with doing this is that the Discord API does not make any guarantees about what fields will be available in what situations. Put in another way, a channel is a single resource with no modeled constraints based on its channel type. This ends up with a lot of duplication between channels for both us and the end user, as well as some difficulties with model channel types when new fields are introduced that don't necessarily make sense in the context of the individual channel mapping.

We took a few approaches towards this API. Other options we considered were: merging *some* types while maintaining the enum pattern; grouping together related guild channel fields into optional groups based on whether they were available; and flattening all channel domains (groups, private channels, and guild channels) into one struct with grouped optional fields. We chose to simply flatten it down all the way, which brings us to an equivalent implementation as that of Discord's model and will prevent breaking changes and API oddities in the future. For more information on these approaches, see issue #1367.

title: perf(model/gateway)!: Optimize `Event` size
body:
- chore(model/gateway): assert `Event` and variant sizes
- refactor(model/gateway)!: Box large `Event` variants
- refactor(model/gateway)!: Unbox small `Event` variants
- refactor(model/gateway)!: Remove box `From<DispatchEvent>`
